newsitem.title: SWEDEN: Sweden's Riksbank keeps discount rate at 2.5 pct.
newsitem.headline: Sweden's Riksbank keeps discount rate at 2.5 pct.

text.p: Sweden's central bank, the Riksbank, said on Tuesday it had set its discount rate at an unchanged 2.5 percent as of April 2.
"The discount rate is merely a reference rate and not in any way connected with monetary policy," the Riksbank said in a statement.
The central bank board sets the discount rate at its first meeting of every quarter solely on the basis of interest rate developments during the preceding quarter.
The rate was set at 2.5 percent in the first quarter and 3.5 percent in the last quarter of 1996.

The rate is computed as an average of the daily market rates for six-month T-bills and five-year government bonds, based on a daily fixing, in the preceding quarter less 2.5 percentage points, rounded to the nearest whole or half point.
